post_text: DMA Parents: All staff report back this week to prepare to give your child the very best education this year. We are starting off remotely for the first four weeks for those that chose "in person" instruction with limited intervention support for those that qualify (we already have called you). For those that chose "Virtual" you will remain this way through the first trimester. We will be working very hard to ensure our online instruction for both options is solid and as much like a normal school day as possible. We can't wait to get started! Thank you for your continued support of Detroit Merit.
text: DMA Parents: All staff report back this week to prepare to give your child the very best education this year. We are starting off remotely for the first four weeks for those that chose "in person" instruction with limited intervention support for those that qualify (we already have called you). For those that chose "Virtual" you will remain this way through the first trimester. We will be working very hard to ensure our online instruction for both options is solid and as much like a normal school day as possible. We can't wait to get started! Thank you for your continued support of Detroit Merit.

post_text:
We miss you and are so excited to welcome you back to school this fall! We are planning for a school year of learning together in an in-person classroom environment. However, we realize things can change between now and the first day of school. Take a moment to watch this video to hear more about how we’re preparing for the 2020-21 school year. We created detailed plans around four learning scenarios. These plans are in-line with our state's department of education plan, which outlines required and recommended safety protocols for the 2020-21 school year based on the status of coronavirus in our community.
For the most up to date information on back to school plan, please visit: https://www.nhaschools.com/en/COVID-19

post_text: Did your child leave something at DMA back in March and you need it? Come tomorrow (June 16th) from 7:30-8:30AM or from 12-1PM or from 5-6PM to get your items. You will drive through the Alter lot. This will be a "no contact" pick up, so stay in your car and let us know who you are picking up for. We will put the items in your trunk. If you cannot come yourself, please make arrangements for someone else to come in your place.
text: Did your child leave something at DMA back in March and you need it? Come tomorrow (June 16th) from 7:30-8:30AM or from 12-1PM or from 5-6PM to get your items. You will drive through the Alter lot. This will be a "no contact" pick up, so stay in your car and let us know who you are picking up for. We will put the items in your trunk. If you cannot come yourself, please make arrangements for someone else to come in your place.

post_text:
Learning does not end when school lets out, and neither does the need for good nutrition!

Nutritious free meals are available for children and teens ages 0-18 at many locations across the nation throughout the summer while school is out of session. Click the link to find a site near you. https://www.mcgi.state.mi.us/schoolnutrition/

post_text:
All students will be provided personal learning devices!

While we may not know exactly what the next school year holds—whether we’re back in school, remote, or a combination of both—we have a plan in place and the technology to support it. All of our students will be provided personal learning devices and will be able to attend online classes.

post_text:
Parents: Below are some resources to help support you and your families during these traumatic events. While we may not be together, we are available to support you and our students. If you need additional resources or would like to speak with our social workers, please contact our main office (313) 331-3328 or email Mrs. Kljajic at 45.jkljajic@nhaschools.com or Mrs. Young at 45.myoung@nhaschools.com.

Parents an article for you:

https://advice.shinetext.com/articles/how-to-stay-woke-and-protect-your-mental-health

A website to teach about racism, violence, inequity & the criminal justice system:

https://www.adl.org/education/resources/tools-and-strategies/teaching-about-racism-violence-inequity-and-the-criminal

A website to use to support your child during this time:

https://www.apa.org/res/parent-resources/

post_text:
Pretty Positives' Free Virtual Summer Camp for girls ages 8-13 from July 6th to July 23rd.

Pretty Positives “Free Virtual Summer Camp “is offering a wide variety of summer—themed learning opportunities with various fun activities during the stay at home confinement.

The Pretty Positives Virtual Summer Camp Mission is to foster self-expression, build confidence through collaborative teamwork, supportive family, community and the virtual environment for a fun summer camp learning experience. The camping experience that our girls would normally be participating in around this time, either attending a physical camp environment and or planned activities with their family. Pretty Positives' Virtual Summer Camp will be a re-imagined summer camp experience.
Sign-up today @ www.prettypositives.com

post_text:
Great info I just recieved...
Church of the Madonna, Oakland and 12th street, gives food every Wednesday beginning at 10 A.M. But no one is coming, and they are afraid of losing their funding if no one comes to get it. All you have to do is drive up and pop your trunk, and they will put a box of food in. Just give them your zip code.
Pass this on!

Thank you to Ms. Miles for the information!

post_text:
From NOYS (some resources for Champions of Yoirh Safety): It's Mental Health Month. According to the National Alliance on Mental Illness, 1 in 5 people will experience a mental illness during their lifetime. Each May, Mental Health Month is observed to help others improve their mental health and increase resiliency. This years theme is Tools 2 Thrive.

https://www.mhanational.org/mental-health-month

post_text:
Wayne Metro has launched Wayne Metro CARES Relief and Recovery Services. Residents may qualify for assistance in the following areas (Programs based on Communities):

Food & Income Support - Distributing food, formula, diapers, wipes & Personal Protection Equipment
Water & Energy Assistance
Rent & Mortgage Assistance
Property Tax Assistance
Emergency Plumbing Repair
Funeral Assistance

More information can be found at https://www.waynemetro.org/cares/. In addition in the coming days you will find a community resource guide on this page.

Individuals and families who need support can call (9am ot 7pm M-F and 9 - noon on Saturday) Wayne Metro at 313-388-9799 (or 734-284-6999) or chat with a specialist on our website.

post_text:
Hey DMA! Check this out. My daughter is a WSU student studying public health and created a fun, spirit week to celebrate public health issues last week.

This is what we’re looking for. Fun, educational things you are doing while at home. Send me pictures and I will post them. Let’s band together and support each other through this public health crisis.

Send a picture doing your school work, a fun experiment, outside playing, reading, making dinner, or whatever tickles your fancy.

Let’s spread messages of hope and joy - together!

Email Ms. Martin at 45.smartin@nhaschools.com

post_text:
Celebrate Reading Month with DMA:

Monday - Draw a picture and post it of your favorite book or character

Tuesday – Turn out the lights, grab a flashlight and find a comfy spot to read – take a picture and post it

Wednesday – Post your favorite recipe and make it together with your family carefully reading the ingredients and directions

Thursday – Act out one of your favorite books as a play or puppet show for your family and post a picture or short video clip

Friday – stay in your PJ’s all day curled up on the couch or a comfortable chair reading – take a picture and post it
text:
Celebrate Reading Month with DMA:

Monday - Draw a picture and post it of your favorite book or character

Tuesday – Turn out the lights, grab a flashlight and find a comfy spot to read – take a picture and post it

Wednesday – Post your favorite recipe and make it together with your family carefully reading the ingredients and directions

Thursday – Act out one of your favorite books as a play or puppet show for your family and post a picture or short video clip

Friday – stay in your PJ’s all day curled up on the couch or a comfortable chair reading – take a picture and post it

post_text:
DMA families: Teachers will be contacting you today with a remote learning plan during out shut down. We appreciate your flexibility and support!

If you have left important and essential materials at DMA (medicine, breathing machines, etc.), you may pick them up Tuesday or Wednesday, March 17th and 18th between 9AM and 2PM. After this, the building will be closed except the vestibule for the distribution of breakfast and lunch.

Contact Ms. Martin via email at 45.smartin@nhaschools with any questions.
